Computes the Poisson loss between y_true & y_pred.

Source: R/autogen-losses.R
loss_poisson.Rd

Formula:

loss = y_pred - y_true * log(y_pred)

Formula:

loss = y_pred - y_true * log(y_pred)

Usage

loss_poisson(
  y_true,
  y_pred,
  ...,
  reduction = "sum_over_batch_size",
  name = "poisson"
)

Arguments

y_true

Ground truth values. shape = [batch_size, d0, .. dN].

y_pred

The predicted values. shape = [batch_size, d0, .. dN].

...

Passed on to the Python callable

reduction

Type of reduction to apply to the loss. In almost all cases this should be "sum_over_batch_size". Supported options are "sum", "sum_over_batch_size" or None.

name

Optional name for the loss instance.

Value

Poisson loss values with shape = [batch_size, d0, .. dN-1].

Examples

y_true = np.random.randint(0, 2, size=(2, 3))
y_pred = np.random.random(size=(2, 3))
loss = keras.losses.poisson(y_true, y_pred)
assert loss.shape == (2,)
y_pred = y_pred + 1e-7
assert np.allclose(
    loss, np.mean(y_pred - y_true * np.log(y_pred), axis=-1),
    atol=1e-5)

See also

  • https:/keras.io/api/losses/probabilistic_losses#poisson-class

  • https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/losses/Poisson

Other loss: loss_binary_crossentropy(), loss_binary_focal_crossentropy(), loss_categorical_crossentropy(), loss_categorical_focal_crossentropy(), loss_categorical_hinge(), loss_cosine_similarity(), loss_hinge(), loss_huber(), loss_kl_divergence(), loss_log_cosh(), loss_mean_absolute_error(), loss_mean_absolute_percentage_error(), loss_mean_squared_error(), loss_mean_squared_logarithmic_error(), loss_sparse_categorical_crossentropy(), loss_squared_hinge()
